subject: Re: External contractor requirements
body:
Hi, I found this email in my spam folder. I’m sorry I don’t recall working for you. Can you specify what this is regarding? 
Sent from my iPhone
On Aug 21, 2023, at 3:39 PM, Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
Dear Kornelia, 
As part of our commitment to compliance, I am conducting an audit of all documentation for external contractors. Your file is missing two forms of identification, which is an IRS requirement for contractor status. Can you please provide us with scans of two forms of identification to satisfy this compliance requirement?
Thank you, 
Maria

subject: Re: External contractor requirements
body:

Hi Maria,
 
Thank you for your continued patience.
 
After review, I can see that the Kentucky State tax agencies and the Kentucky Owensboro/Daviess County tax agencies are in 'Calculate Only' level of service(LOS) with us from Dec 20th, 2022.
 
Please be informed that, in 'Calculate Only', Trinet Zenefits will calculate any employee/employer taxes related to a jurisdiction and display this amount in your quarterly tax package. With Calculate Only, Zenefits will not withdraw funds for the calculated taxes, remit the calculated tax amounts, file tax returns, or resolve notices for the respective tax agency.
 
Hence, please note that you are responsible for filing the Kentucky taxes to the appropriate agency for your employee Kaitlin Nonweiler.
 
To view your level of service for your Zenefits payroll tax filing:
1. Log in to Zenefits as the company administrator.
2. Click on the 
Payroll app
 in the main dashboard.
3. Click 
Settings
 in the top navigation bar, then click Taxes in the left-hand menu.
4. Next to each state, you will see either the "Full Service" or "Calculate Only" labels.
 
Please feel free to contact us if you have any other questions.
 
Best regards,
Raghavendra | Customer Advocate, Time & Pay | Trinet Zenefits |

subject: Fwd: What is our culture?
body:
Get 
Outlook for iOS
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 23, 2023 1:00:52 PM
To:
 Office <office@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 What is our culture?
 
 
 
Culture isn't event programming; it's what fills the space between them.
💩
 Culture isn't the yoga class offered every Tuesday; but the shared expectation of overwork that keeps everyone in your office from attending.
💩
 Culture isn't the monthly heritage celebration; but the normalized snide remarks, exclusionary comments, and racial microaggressions that make it clear that Black, Latine, Indigenous, Asian, and mixed employees don't belong.
💩
 Culture isn't the quarterly teambuilding event; but the unspoken power dynamics and hierarchies that dictate who speaks, who is seen, and who gets credit.
This misunderstanding is why even organizations flooded with events can nevertheless have toxic cultures...and why even organizations without any formal events at all can have incredible ones. Understand that culture is what "fills the space," and you'll start to see how to actually create it.
🌱
 Culture is how people treat each other when no one's looking.
🌱
 Culture is how you respond to a crisis.
🌱
 Culture is how you celebrate, but also how you grieve, mourn, learn, and process.
🌱
 Culture is what you value and prioritize.
🌱
 Culture is your shared identity and guiding compass.
We can build and shape the workplace cultures around us, but it doesn't happen through event programming alone. Leaders, both those with formal leadership titles and those without, create culture. Incentives, structures, and processes, formal and informal, serve as culture's foundation. And yes—events and important moments express it and maintain it.
It can be all to easy to "start with events" and go from there, like buying the decorations for your plane before you've built it. It's easy. It's flashy. But the toxicity you let breed while building this empty "culture" hurts everyone. Building culture takes real work—don't be tempted by the shortcuts.
 
Lily Zheng Linked In post from 8/22/2023
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

subject: FW: External contractor requirements
body:
Hi Maria,
I would like to confirm (from a HR standpoint) the documentation we need to have on file for new vendors. Up until now, we have only required the following:
1. LCW Agreement signed
2. W9 (or W8 form signed for non-US).
3. Contractor Profile Information + Payment preferences
(Attached is a sample of the package)
I'm inquiring because of your email requesting two additional forms of identification from our vendors. Thank you for guiding us through the new process and its requirements.
 
Maria Fagrelius
Director of Global Language Solutions
LCW

From:
 Maria Fagrelius 
Sent:
 Tuesday, August 22, 2023 7:37 AM
To:
 Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: External contractor requirements
 
Good morning, Maria. I hope you're well. I wanted to bring up the emails you sent to our contractors yesterday. I've received some feedback, and it appears that there might be a few points we could improve upon for clarity.
Given that most of our contractors are located overseas, it would be helpful if you could provide more specific details about the types of identifications that are acceptable for the purpose mentioned in the emails. This will prevent any confusion and ensure a smoother process.
In the future, it could be beneficial to include me in these communications. This will not only keep me informed but also address any concerns from translators who might be questioning the legitimacy of the emails. As you know, requesting identification forms through email is a common tactic used by spammers, so adding an official company signature (LCW signature) could lend credibility and trustworthiness to our communications.
If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
 
Maria Fagrelius
Director of Global Language Solutions

LCW

subject: RE: External contractor requirements
body:
Dear Maria,
I hope this message finds you well. I appreciate your diligence in ensuring compliance with IRS requirements for contractor status. However, I must admit that I have some concerns about the recent email I received requesting additional forms of identification.
Given the sensitive nature of personal information, I believe it's essential to exercise caution when sharing such details. As you can understand, providing personal identification documents to an unfamiliar source raises security and privacy concerns.
To ensure that we handle this matter appropriately, I kindly request that you provide me with more information about your organisation and the specific compliance measures you are conducting. It would be helpful to verify this request's legitimacy and establish a level of trust between us.
If you could please share some details about your company, the audit process, and any official channels through which I can confirm your identity, I would be more than willing to cooperate in a way that aligns with the best practices for safeguarding personal information.
Thank you for your understanding. I look forward to receiving your response and clarifying this matter further.
Best regards,
Monika
 
Kind regards,
Monika Rozwarzewska

subject: Will send next week / RE: External contractor requirements
body:
Hi Maria,
Thank you for your request.  I am currently traveling and will get you the requested information upon my return next week.  I also had to check if your message was legit as I almost deleted it without reading it because:
It is unusual to receive email from your email address.
It had no information in your signature.
The subject was ambiguous.
There was no personalization in the body of the email besides my name.
I wanted to share this because there are way too many scams out there and one can never be too cautious.  
Have a great rest of the week.

Subject:
 Deadline Approaching: Submit Your MSP Data by Sept. 8th
 
Medicare Secondary Payer Information Needed
 
 
Dear Group Administrator,
Your health insurer or third-party administrator, such as Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois (BCBSIL), is responsible for your health plan's quarterly reporting to the federal government concerning how your health plan coordinates with any Medicare coverage for which your employees may be eligible. This reporting helps to ensure proper claim payments for your employees. You are responsible for providing us annually with timely and accurate information pertaining to your employee count. The failure to provide timely and accurate information may affect your employees' claim payments.
BCBSIL collects this information through the Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) Employer Acknowledgement Form (EAF). The MSP EAF will be available online from 
June 5 through September 8, 2023
 for renewing groups. It's easy to complete in 
Blue Access for Employers
SM
 (BAE
SM
).
 If you handle multiple accounts, please remember to update all of them through BAE.
It is your responsibility to promptly update BCBSIL of any employee count changes throughout the year. Details about the reporting provisions from CMS can be found
here
.
Your Next Steps (BY SEPTEMBER 8):
Step 1: 
Log into 
BAE
 or 
Register Here
 if you are new to BAE.
Step 2:
Click 
View Regulatory Data
 located on the left side of the home page.
Step 3:
Enter your 2023 MSP information.
1
Step 4:
Click 
SUBMIT 
to finalize.
Thank you,
Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois
